thread.title: Harry and William on DIY SOS made everyone feel proud to be British
thread.title_full: Harry and William on DIY SOS made everyone feel proud to be British

title: Harry and William on DIY SOS made everyone feel proud to be British
text:
Harry and William on DIY SOS made everyone feel proud to be British Harry and William on DIY SOS made everyone feel proud to be British 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Prince Harry and the Duke of Cambridge joined Nick Knowles and his team of helpers for a very special edition of DIY SOS: The Big Build. The royals were applauded on Twitter for being all-round great blokes (BBC/PA) 
The royals and hundreds of volunteers got stuck in to convert a derelict street in Manchester into homes for army veterans suffering with post traumatic stress disorder. 
And there was not a dry eye in the house. Emotions were running high on site (BBC/PA) 
Within minutes Twitter was in tears as the teamâ€™s efforts to help retired veterans touched hearts. I'm not sure I'm emotionally ready for a DIY SOS big build ğŸ˜“ 
â€” Kate Robinson (@ktrobinsonx) October 14, 2015 I'm 2/1 to shed a tear at DIY SOS tonight 
â€” Luke Mackay (@MackayLuke19) October 14, 2015 
Emotions were running high as Nick and the team feared they would not finish the build in time. But luckily two extra helpers rocked up to lend a hand. 
And they even got their own personalised hats. The royals reporting for duty (Phil Noble/PA) 
Oops. Good old Billy. 
â€” Dave (@daisyhigs) October 14, 2015 
William and Harry came off as all round great blokes. Watching DIY SOS and just wanting Prince Harry to be KING OF THE WOOOORLD. He's turned into such a bloody decent bloke. â¤ï¸ 
â€” Emma Tofi (@EmmaTofi) October 14, 2015 Harry and Wills are some of the nicest blokes ever! Good work all round DIY SOS Team #DIYSOSVeterans 
â€” Abigayle Higgins (@Absofabso97) October 14, 2015 William and Harry on DIY sos, what awesome Lads! 
â€” Matt Dickenson (@Matt__Dicko) October 14, 2015 
And someone in particular was a hit with the ladies. Prince Harry looking edible on DIY sos wow wow 
â€” isabella coxon (@isabellacxxx) October 14, 2015 Oh my God, Prince Harry on DIY SOS. What a stunning man! His facial hair is something else ğŸ˜ 
â€” Emily Jayne Turner (@emilyjayne90) October 14, 2015 
Luckily the team pulled it off. "This is about us saying thank you to you" 
â€” DIY SOS (@DIYSOS) October 14, 2015 
Cue more tears. Sobbing my heart out at DIY SOS. ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ğŸ˜­ Have so much love & respect for our soldiers. Our heroes. ğŸ’œ 
â€” Holly Olivia (@hollyoliviablog) October 14, 2015 
And everyone watching had never felt prouder to be British! This DIY SOS is so moving! For such a good cause & guys who put there lives on the line for our country! ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ #DIYSOSVeterans #sograteful 
â€” Amanda Wilkinson (@AmandaW_7) October 14, 2015 DIY SOS is a tear jerker, but tonight Prince Harry & William were on it & they make me so proud of our country! Love our Royal family ğŸ˜ŠğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ 
â€” Lucy Florence (@lucyflorencew) October 14, 2015 Amazing scenes on DIY SOS veteransâ€¦. So proud to be British #DIYSOSVeterans 
â€” Julie Whitmore (@juliewhitmore) October 14, 2015 Watching DIY SOS helping our veterans feeling so proud, they deserve it x ğŸ‘ ğŸ’‚ğŸ» ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ ğŸ‘ 
â€” Suzanne Shoker (@SuzanneShoker1) October 14, 2015 DIY SOS tonight shows the predominantly British culture of giving time and skill freely for a good cause! 
â€” Brian Enderwitz (@treksmartLtd) October 14, 2015 
As we said â€“ not a dry eye in the house. Great I can now add DIY SOS to the list of unlikely TV shows that have made me cry. 
â€” Jack Whitehall (@jackwhitehall) October 14, 2015 
Well done Nick and the team! Watching @MrNickKnowles and DIY SOS team big build. You're a credit to society. An amazing thing you have done for ex service personnel. 
â€” Nicole 5FDP4L (@nicbunny) October 14, 2015 @DIYSOS @MrNickKnowles as a mother of a serving memberâ€¦ Thank you from the bottom of my heart x
